Эта часть переносит нас из глубин океана в небо, из Восторга в Колумбию. По своей красоте новый город не уступает старому и, по моему мнению, даже выигрывает. Сюжет же просто восхитителен. Не думал, что после отличной первой части и не очень хорошей второй разработчики выкинут что-то подобное. С одной стороны, жаль, что убрали ту зависимость концовки от действий игрока, которая была в предыдущих частях серии. С другой же, концовка божетсвенна. Не хочется в ней что-либо менять. Ну и конечно, хочется отметить Элизабет :3. Она не только очень красивый и живой персонаж, но и временами очень помогает, подкидывая патроны, аптечки или деньги. В общем, Bioshock Infinite - отличнейшая игра, которую обязательно стоит пройти. Да и Burial at Sea, который переносит нас обратно в Восторг, тоже очень даже хорошее дополнение к такой игре.
Juego impresionante y mas al precio al que esta en las rebajas. Graficos muy buenos, jugabilidad estupenda y ambientacion muy bien hechA. Diferente a cualquier otro shooter.

Wow! What a game. I feel I'd ruin the experience talking about it. All I want to say is that if you haven't played it, I highly suggest that you do.

활력과 무기의 조합 및 연계, 그리고 엘리자베스의 도움과 분열 활용 등은 게임의 다양한 플레이가 나올 수 있도록 한다.

특히, 나같은 건 앤 슛 매니아는 활력의 띄우기가 매우 OP다.

여기까지는 플레이상 내용이었고, 줄거리는 꽤나 충격적이다.

컬럼비아의 존재 이유와 콤스탁, 부커 드윗 , 엘리자베스의 존재를 전부 마지막에 적어놨는데

반전은 꽤나 충격적이다.

이것을 알고 싶다면 추천.

Immenso e profondo,ti trascina dentro e ti lascia affascinato per la trama complessa e gli intrecci.

Ottima giocabilità,anche su pc poco potenti e comandi molto intuitivi.

"BioShock Infinite" is an epic fps (First-Person Shooter) taking place in 1912, in the floating utopia of Columbia. An absolutly astounding 3rd entry to the "--Shock" series, it terrifies, then overloads you with feels! 10/10!
Jogo muito bom!

Bioshock Infinite was a very enjoyable romp through the Bioshock Universe with an interesting, even if a bit predictable, story and  new game mechanics that added quite a bit of fun.

Add to that the Burial at Sea DLC and the Bioshock story as a whole is elevated. The way the Burial at Sea story is woven to bring together Bioshock, Bioshock 2 and Bishock Infinite is masterfully done in my opinion. Infinite and  it's DLC may not have been treated very kindly by some of the game review media or even some fans of the franchise but I do whole heartedly recommend playing both infinite and the Burial at Sea DLC at least once. The game play and mechanics may not be ground breaking or redefine the genre but the story of the game is well worth the time for gamers who can over look the other things and find joy in the story they are being told.
The story is great so far.
Great game, a great campaign ending and lots of awesome action. 10/10 would buy for all consoles

State from the beginning I have not finished this yet. I was so looking forward to getting this one after playing Bioshock 1 & 2 and reading all the good things about this one. Have to say so far unimpressed and enjoyed Bioshock 1 more, 2 was average though. May have something to do with the new worlds that Bioshock opened up to me and feel a little jaded after 2. But although the Infinite world looks big and open I feel claustrophobic and linear with the game play. Which was ok deep under water in the other Bioshocks but up here in the sky you just feel like you should have more options with opening up the world.
Still very playable and enjoyable just a little disappointing.

Excellent game with an intriguing storyline and great visual effects. As many reviews will indicate, the middle of the story line sags a bit, but the end of the game is quite a mind-trip. I had never played previous incarnations of BioShock so this was my first foray into the game. By the end of the game I found myself wanting more so I purchased all the DLCs and purchased BioShock 1 and 2. After playing BioShock Infinite, I found the BioShock 1 left me wanting more in terms of visual effects and controls. Throughout all of BioShock Infinite, there seem to be very few (if any) parts that required you to have played one of the first two games in the franchise to understand the storyline or gameplay, but [spoiler]the end of the game does have some tie in with the previous two games in the franchise[/spoiler]. I guess if there is one thing to take away from this it is to consider playing the originals before jumping into Infinite.

Il était nécéssaire de publier une évaluation pour ce jeux, tant l'histoire est magnifique. même si vous n'aimez pas les FPS, il faudrait en faire un film de ce 3ème épisode juste pour le scénario...

Plus sérieusement, pour avoir jouer aux deux premiers épisodes également, celui-ci est de loin le meilleur. L'histoire n'a plus rien a voir avec le 1 & le 2 même si nous retrouvons une ambiance Steampunk.

si vous chercher un FPS a jouer, avec des armes sympas, un décors magnifique, ne cherchez plus ce jeux mérite que l'on prenne du temps pour y jouer et surtout pour le finir.

Les DLC ont également l'air sympa, mais seul le scenario de base m'interressait, je n'ai donc pas essayé les extensions.

Muy buena jugabilidad similar a la de las anteriores entregas, con la inclusión de variantes que hacen del juego mucho más rápido y diverso que sus predecesores. Una estupenda trama bien lograda, con un gran final, que deja ganas de más.
El apartado musical como siempre increíble, las ambientaciones si bien no tan espectaculares como la primera impresión que causaron con Bioshock  y Bioshock 2, están estupendamente logradas, a pesar de ser un juego "lineal" muchas veces se pierde esta visión lo que se agradece.
Una buena dificultad de juego, para todos los gustos.
La inclusión de los personajes en la historia de Rapture en los dlcs creo que es un necesario para todo seguidor de estos títulos.

Вспомните вашу самую любимую историю, от которой у вас дух захватывает. Потом представьте, что она была рассказана в игре. Вот это примерно и будет Биошок Инфинит.

The graphics are really lovely, and the combat set up is good and so is the gameplay aspect. 

 The character designs are okay... they're a mixture of steampunk and period clothing apporate of the Era that it was set in.

 However... the story itself can be kind of problematic. First of all, there's a lot of racism and classim going on in this game... there's so much of it that it's pretty much shoved into your face. A lot of people would agrue that it was proper for the game because of it being set in the 1920's or something like that... but the thing is, I doubt that the majority of people back then were this carrtoonishly racist/classist. I think most people in 1920 would act like normal people for the most part, with casual racism thrown into the mix once in a while if the situation for it arouse. They wouldn't be right in your face about it.
    But then again, this floating city was all run by a bunch of exemetrists.... so I guess it does make sense.
   
  But I'm throwing that information out there just in case those who were new to the game had triggers for this sort of thing... that's the sort of theme that can make or break a game for players.

 That said, I wouldn't mind playing this game all the though way again.
What are you waiting for? Buy it already! One of the best games I've ever played!

5/5 One of the best games I have ever played. The art direction is fantastic and the world is fully realised. Elisabeth is a prime example of how to do companion characters right. The game isn't too hard, but you can unlock the option to play the game in 1999 mode, which will offer a real challenge. It's a shame that Irrational closed after creating this masterpiece, but they went out with a bang.

Ok. I have never played a Bioshock game, Ill admit to it. But when i saw this on sale and heard good things about it, what the heck, i bought it. Im not much of a story kind of person when it comes to video games, especially fps, but man this game gave me a headache (A good one, if theres such a thing). It got me thinking a lot what was actually going on. I dont think I beat a game that quick. It only took me 8 hours and everytime i had to stop and go do something, i wanted to come back for more. Even with the story being a little hard to understand, its a fun game with fun combat, AMAZING graphics, and tons of fun. I do wish it was a little longer or theres something else to do, besides the dlc episodes. Other then that, its just an amazing game and you should buy this on sale, or full price. Doesnt matter because its so worth the time and money. I promise you that.

This game is simply brilliant. Having played the other games in the Bioshock franchise, I was at first skeptical about enjoying another world other than Rapture, but Columbia is equally as beautiful and fun to explore. The use of sky-lines is a great touch which varies your method of transport, and combat, whilst Elizabeth's ability to open tears adds a another dimension to combat. The storyline is so detailed and continuely keeps you on your toes to shock you. The main characters, Booker and Elizabeth, are easy to empathise with and you can get much more involved in their choices and feelings than you can in other games. The use of vigors, similar to the other Bioshock games, are fun to play with and can be used in combinations to help elimante your enemies faster - making you feel ultimately powerful when you take down a difficult boss. Bioshock Infinite has so much replay value, whether its for finding all of the voxophones that enable you to discover more of the truth about Columbia's history, or simply to try and complete the game in hard difficulty and 1999 mode. The game is simply beautfiul to play.

The DLC available to buy is just as irresistible as the main game. Clash in the Clouds offers wave-based levels where you battle off against enemies for as long as possible. Burial At Sea, though, is where everything makes sense. Parts 1 and 2 link Columbia and Rapture together in a different storyline that is long enough to feel like a mini game. Both parts help to answer many unsolved questions of the Bioshock franchise and have left me more knowledgable of the games, but also made me want to play the whole franchise again and again! I would recommend not playing Bioshock Infinite's Burial at Sea DLC until having played the other Bioshock games as past events from the franchise are alluded to in the DLC.

Overall, Bioshock Infinite is one of my favourite games. As a lover of the whole franchise, this latest installment has done it proud.  As they say, "there's always a man, always a lighthouse, and always a city".

Now, would you kindly buy and play this game?

I played this before having played any other Bioshock games, which I was told wouldn't be a problem. I think that definitely held true. The game was fun, although perhaps a little long (an abnormal complain, I know). The save system was also frustrating. While I don't like power gaming via quick saves/loads, BioShock Infinite really punishes you for stepping away from the game. Checkpoints weren't very clear to me, and as a result I had to replay some areas. In the end, though, it was a fun game.

Overall, a very enjoyable game. Bioshock Infinite focuses more on a run-and-gun style of gameplay than its predecesor's more RPG exploration focused experience. While I missed this aspect of Bioshock, I found that the restrictions placed on gameplay elements (only having two guns at a time and only having two equipt vigors) in a way made the game more enjoyable because it had you customizing your limited supplies to what suits your style.
